intro: Persicaria minor subsp. micrantha, commonly known as dwarf knotweed, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to eastern North America. It typically grows to a height of about 15–30 cm, featuring slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, pinkish-white flowers in late summer, which are arranged in dense spikes. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in wetlands, streambanks, and woodland edges. Due to its hardy nature and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
